data.title: Study Law Program at University of Bristol: Tuition Fees and Eligibility Criteria
data.meta_description: Let's learn about the University of Bristol Law entry requirements. See the institute's criteria, application process, rankings, and more.
data.text:
Wondering about the University of Bristol Law entry requirements for international students? Ranking #55 among the world’s top universities, the Law program offered by the prestigious UK-based institute promises world-class education in the field. To apply, students generally need 80-90% (A-levels: AAA or higher, IB Diploma: 36 points or higher) for the LLB program and 55-60% for LLM. So if you want to pursue your legal studies through Bristol, then dive into this blog to read more about the entry requirements of the Law program for international students.

Why Study Law at the University of Bristol?

Ranking consistently in the top 10 for Law in the UK, the University of Bristol Law entry requirements are competitive, with an acceptance rate of 11.65 – 13.51%. This indicates the top-notch knowledge the program imparts to its learners, providing them with a well-rounded education in the field of law.

The program sits at #3 in the UK for excellence in legal research (THE analysis of REF 2021), with 93% of research rated as world-leading or internationally excellent. You’ll be taught by world-renowned academics who are actively shaping policy and legal practice. Given below are some other features of Bristol’s Law program:

Lays a solid foundation in legal knowledge and explores a wide range of legal topics with a global perspective.

Encourages critical thinking about legal issues in today’s interconnected world.

Offers an LLB Law with Study Abroad option, allowing you to gain experience in another legal system.

Gain practical experience through the University’s embedded law clinic, working on real-life cases.

Opportunities to gain Qualifying Work Experience (QWE) which can be crucial for pursuing legal careers in the UK.

The Law School has strong connections with international law firms, barristers’ chambers and social justice organizations, aiding your future career path.

Also Read: University of Melbourne LLM: Courses, Fees, Entry Requirements, Application Deadline, Scholarships

University of Bristol Law Entry Requirements

The University of Bristol Law entry requirements vary depending on the chosen program level and a student’s nationality. Let’s explore these criteria one by one for international students:

For Undergraduate Programs

Students must fulfil any of the following academic qualifications for Bristol’s Law program:

English Language requirements: IELTS (6.5 overall) or 70-80% or higher in CBSE/CICSE English.

For Postgraduate Programs

The graduate law courses at Bristol require a first-class degree (60% or above) with distinction from a recognized Indian university as a student’s bachelor qualifications. It may also accept students with 55% from select Indian colleges.

Note: The above entry requirements apply only to Indian students. To check the specific course requirements for your country, you can visit this official requirements page for international students.

List of University of Bristol Law Courses (with Tuition Fees)

The above Bristol Law entry requirements also differ with the level and specialization of Law course chosen by the students. The LLB is a 3-year full-time course, whereas LLM tuition fee for the Law programs ranges from £20,900 – £26,700 per year for international students, with LLB charging £23,900 per year.

Given below are some popular law specializations available at Bristol:

Also Read: University of Warwick MBA: Requirements, Fees, Ranking, and More

Bristol Law Entry Requirements: Application Process

Once you satisfy the University of Bristol Law entry requirements, here are the steps to you need to follow to apply for the same:

Head to the UCAS website and create a new account.

Double-check the chosen Law program webpage for any program-specific application requirements.

During the application process, you’ll need to provide the University of Bristol’s UCAS institution code, which is BRISL B78.

Gather all the necessary documents to attach to the application.

Fill out the application form and submit it well before the deadline.

Note: Applications typically open in early September for entry the following year. The equal consideration deadline for international applications is January 31st of your planned entry year. It means your application has the best chance of being considered before spaces fill up. However, the absolute deadline for all international applications is June 30th.

Bristol Law Entry Requirements: Documents Required

Official academic transcripts (translated into English if required)

Proof of English Language proficiency (IELTS, PTE)

Personal statement

2 letters of recommendation
